Package gui

Class BookingModifyPage

java.lang.Object
gui.DisposableObject
gui.BookingPage
gui.BookingPageCustomer
gui.BookingModifyPage
Direct Known Subclasses:
Book
public class BookingModifyPage extends BookingPageCustomer
Comprehensive booking modification interface for existing reservation management with enhanced passenger controls.

This class extends BookingPageCustomer to provide specialized functionality for modifying existing flight bookings within the airport management system. It offers advanced passenger management capabilities including dynamic passenger addition and removal, comprehensive validation, and flexible booking status management for both confirmed and pending reservations.

The BookingModifyPage class supports comprehensive booking modification operations including:

  • Dynamic Passenger Management: Real-time addition and removal of passengers with capacity validation
  • Enhanced Interface Controls: Specialized buttons for passenger removal and booking management
  • Flexible Booking Status: Support for both confirmed and pending reservation modifications
  • Comprehensive Validation: Multi-level validation for passenger data and booking constraints
  • Seat Management: Advanced seat availability checking considering existing bookings
  • User Feedback: Real-time validation feedback and error messaging through floating messages
  • Navigation Integration: Seamless integration with application navigation and workflow management
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • BookingModifyPage

      public BookingModifyPage(List<DisposableObject> callingObjects, Controller controller, Dimension dimension, Point point, int fullScreen)
      Constructs a new BookingModifyPage interface for existing reservation modification.

      This constructor initializes the complete booking modification interface by extending the BookingPageCustomer functionality and configuring it specifically for existing booking modification workflows. The constructor establishes the main application window with proper sizing, positioning, and integration with the calling object hierarchy.

      The initialization process includes:

      • Inheriting passenger management capabilities from the parent class
      • Establishing window properties including size, position, and display state
      • Integrating with the application's disposable object management system
      • Configuring the interface for existing booking modification workflows
      • Setting up the main frame visibility and user interaction readiness
      Parameters:
      callingObjects - the list of parent objects in the application navigation hierarchy for proper resource management and navigation
      controller - the system controller providing access to flight management, booking operations, and data persistence
      dimension - the preferred window size for the booking modification interface
      point - the screen position where the booking modification window should be displayed
      fullScreen - the window state indicating whether the interface should be maximized or in normal window mode

    • BookingModifyPage

      public BookingModifyPage(List<DisposableObject> callingObjects, Controller controller, Dimension dimension, Point point, int fullScreen, boolean flag)
      Constructs a new BookingModifyPage interface with controller disposal flag configuration.

      This overloaded constructor provides additional control over controller resource management by accepting a disposal flag that determines whether the controller should be disposed of when the interface is closed. This is particularly useful for integration scenarios where the controller may be shared across multiple interface components.

      Parameters:
      callingObjects - the list of parent objects in the application navigation hierarchy for proper resource management and navigation
      controller - the system controller providing access to flight management, booking operations, and data persistence
      dimension - the preferred window size for the booking modification interface
      point - the screen position where the booking modification window should be displayed
      fullScreen - the window state indicating whether the interface should be maximized or in normal window mode
      flag - the controller disposal flag indicating whether controller resources should be disposed when the interface closes
